intro: Gallitrichum, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange composite flowers that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Gallitrichum species are often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
